title: How to Make a Chia Breakfast Bowl

methods.name: Making a Basic Chia Breakfast Bowl

steps.headline: Combine the chia seeds, milk, syrup, and vanilla extract in a large bowl.
steps.description: Stir everything together with a rubber spatula until just combined. Don't worry about making individual servings just yet. You will mix everything together first. Almond milk is recommended, but you can use other types of milk as well. If you can't find any maple syrup or honey, you can use another type of sweetener, such as coconut nectar, agave nectar, or stevvia.

steps.headline: Let the mixture sit for 30 minutes, then give it a stir.
steps.description: During this time, the chia seeds will soak up the milk and become thicker. Once the mixture thickens, give it a stir. This will help combine the ingredients further and prevent them from clumping up. Be sure to scrape the bottom of the jar.

steps.headline: Cover the bowl and leave it in the fridge overnight.
steps.description: This is not absolutely necessary, but many people prefer the thick, pudding-like texture that the chia seeds get by the following morning. You can cover the bowl with a lid or plastic wrap. This is simply to help keep the chia seeds moist and prevent them from drying out.

steps.headline: Distribute the mixture between two bowls.
steps.description: Take the bowl out of the fridge. Give it another stir. Ladle the chia seed mixture into two bowls. Use a rubber spatula to scrape the bowl clean so that you don't waste anything.

steps.headline: Top it off with some sliced fruit and nuts, if desired.
steps.description: Wash, peel, and slice your favorite fruit, then layer it on top of the bowl in even stripes. Try using a combination of different fruits for a more colorful (and tasty) bowl. Add a handful of nuts, seeds, or granola to one side of the bowl. Leave smaller fruits, such as blackberries, raspberries, and blueberries whole. How much fruit you use is up to you! Some people like to cover the entire surface of the bowl with fruit, while others like to use only a few slices.

methods.name: Making an Oatmeal Chia Breakfast Bowl

steps.headline: Place the rolled oats, chia seeds, and milk into a large bowl.
steps.description: Don't worry about making separate servings just yet. You will be mixing everything together first, then dividing it up later. If you can't find "roll oats" use "old-fashioned oats" instead. Soy milk is recommended for this recipe, but you can use other types as well.

steps.headline: Add some flavorful extras.
steps.description: At this point, you can add in some maple syrup or honey, or even a dash of cinnamon. If you can't find any maple syrup or honey, try coconut nectar or agave nectar.

steps.headline: Stir everything together.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to fold the ingredients together. Be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often.

steps.headline: Cover the bowl and place it in the fridge.
steps.description: You can cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a lid. This will keep the mixture from drying out. Leave it in the fridge for at least 1 hour. Overnight would be better, however. During this time, the oatmeal and chia seeds will soak up the mix and become thicker.

steps.headline: Divide the mixture between two bowls.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to help guide the mixture into each bowl. If the oatmeal is too thick for you, stir in some more milk. The more milk you add, the thinner your breakfast bowl will be.

steps.headline: Top each bowl off with some sliced fruit and nuts, if desired.
steps.description: Wash, peel, and slice a few pieces of your favorite types of fruit, then layer them on top of the bowl in even stripes. Grab a handful of nuts, seeds, or granola, and add it to one side of the bowl. Leave smaller fruits, such as blackberries, raspberries, and blueberries whole. How much fruit and nuts you add is up to you.

methods.name: Making a Yogurt Chia Breakfast Bowl

steps.headline: Combine the chia seeds, milk, and yogurt in a large bowl.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to stir everything together. Scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often so that everything gets evenly mixed. Almond milk is recommended for this recipe, but you can use a different type of milk as well. You can use any type of yogurt you like. Flavored yogurt is recommended, but you can use plain if you prefer.

steps.headline: Stir in some cinnamon.
steps.description: If you don't like cinnamon, you can use another type of baking spice or sweetener. If you used flavored yogurt, such as vanilla or strawberry, then you probably don't need to add much, if anything, in. If you used plain yogurt, however, a dash of cinnamon or a drizzle of honey or maple syrup would be a good idea.

steps.headline: Let the mixture sit for 1 hour, then give it a stir.
steps.description: During this time, the chia seeds will soak up the liquid and thicken up. Once the chia seeds thicken, give them another quick stir. This will help prevent things from clumping up.

steps.headline: Cover the bowl and leave it in the fridge overnight.
steps.description: You can cover the bowl with a sheet of plastic wrap or a tight-fitting lid. The mixture will continue to thicken, giving you a tasty, pudding-like treat for breakfast the following morning. If you are too impatient, you can eat the breakfast bowl the same day. It may not be as thick, however.

steps.headline: Distribute the mixture between two bowls.
steps.description: Give the mixture a good stir first. If it is too thick, stir in some more milk. Use a rubber spatula to help guide the mixture into two bowls. Be sure to scrape the bowl clean!

steps.headline: Top it off with your choice of sliced fruit and nuts, if desired.
steps.description: Wash, peel, and slice up a few pieces of your favorite fruit. Layer the fruit on top of the bowl in even stripes. Toss in a handful of nuts, seeds, or granola for extra crunch. Leave smaller fruits, such as blackberries, raspberries, and blueberries whole. Try to use a combination of different types of fruit. How much fruit and nuts you add is up to you.
